content.question: Let R be the shaded region bounded by the graphs of <math> <mrow> <mi>y</mi> <mo>=</mo> <msqrt> <mi>x</mi> </msqrt> </mrow> </math> and y = e-3x and the vertical line x = 1, as shown in the figure above. (a) Find the area of R.

frqParts.text: Let R be the shaded region bounded by the graphs of <math> <mrow> <mi>y</mi> <mo>=</mo> <msqrt> <mi>x</mi> </msqrt> </mrow> </math> and y = e-3x and the vertical line x = 1, as shown in the figure above. (a) Find the area of R.
(b) Find the volume of the solid generated when R is revolved about the horizontal line y = 1.

(c) The region R is the base of a solid. For this solid, each cross section perpendicular to the x-axis is a rectangle whose height is 5 times the length of its base in region R. Find the volume of this solid.

topic.text: 8.4: Finding the Area Between Curves Expressed as Functions of x

skill.text: Skill 1.E: Apply appropriate mathematical rules or procedures, with and without technology.
